reviews.review: this games only been out one day and i would like to say that it is good, but theres one problem with the game. and it is that, as a killer when you hit someone twice and they are crawling on the ground. if the person crawling goes next to one of the windows that you can jump over the person cannot be picked up and carried by the killer.this is something that i have experienced first hand and i would be nice if it coule be fixed instead of me just vaulting over the window.
spooked

Owned the game for 23 minutes. Spent 20 minutes trying to find a lobby that would execute the game. Never got passed lobby. Got frustrated and left. No party system either. I would not suggest this game to a friend in the current state. Refunded, will be watching patch notes for possible future purchase.


UPDATED REVIEW: It's been 4 years. Game is still trash.

Gotta say this game gets incredibly intense, and very few games make me shake out of "excitement." 
Haven't really done much in terms of playing the survivor. But being the killer is shockingly fun. Its harder than it seems, unless you get a group of players who obviously has no idea what to do, then its just a breeze. 

The graphics are ok, nothing to remember but, if you looking for a jeepers creepers like experience this game is for you. Shit even if you want to massacre idiots with the chainsaw it is for you. 

The only problem I have with this game is really the fact that the animations are clunky, few bugs, and the map gets a little old. 

However I see a potentially bright future if they keep adding content and methods to murder or survive.

Thumbs up!

Sits in the lobby as a killer for 10 years, joins a lobby as a survivor in 1 second. Either every fucking kid wants to be a killer, or every fucking KID WANTS TO BE A KILLER. Like wtf is this shit, I'm over here seeing other people get into games as a killer easy peasy, and I'm here playing akons song so lonely while I stare at my screen as hours pass by...
Very addicting with a pretty good progression system, like it so far! Could need some tweaks though.

All the games i play using windowed mode with a 1920 x 1080P. But this one I can not and when I try to physically change the document folder to make it so it fit my 1 monitor it keeps expanding the image so it takes up all three screens which leaves the game unplayable and an unenjoyable. Not how a  resolution screen button is the most stupidest idea that this game has. When playing the screen you using is 5 X closer to the person and Is stretched so badly you cant even see if someone was right behind you and or at your feet.

I read that some people says that it is still alpha, is really bugged and you can only play in private matches (?). 

None of those things have been a problem or true for me, it doesn't look alpha, so far I haven't seen any noticeable annoying bug and I just created a lobby as a killer and random people starts to join.. as a survivor I joined a lobby and the same. Everything OK.

What is true is that in the lobby many people go in and out extending the time when the game starts...but usually, in average, a game starts in around  40 seconds and if many people start going in and out (for some reason that I still don't understand) it takes longer... like 1 min and a half or 2. Overall the game is enjoyable, really fun, according to the price. (maybe I would expect a few more features... i.e. a bigger gap between the type of skills of each survivor). 

Overall score 6.5/10 for me.
*Hopefully we will see other maps and different types of characters in the future.

Edit. After 3 hours: Changed 7.5 to 6.5 because...yes, it has some bugs. It looks like a good Beta. Sometimes even killing all the survivors (by hanging them) you are still there without going to the score screen and it is getting common that after the loading screen of the game as a Killer, the game end up crashing (escaping all survivors) and/or being a survivor getting an inmediate escape screen because the other killer probably crashed too. Still, the game is good...for the price and hopefully future fixes and updates.

Dead by Bugs.
6 Stunden Spielzeit ? Höchstens 1,5 Std, den rest der Zeit hab ich damit verbracht nen Game zu finden.
Items Benutzen ? Nich immer möglich , man nimmt ein item mit kann es aber nicht benutzen und nach dem Game ist das Item weg egal ob gewonnen oder verloren.
Der Haken Bug ist der geilste von allen.
Du wirst vom Haken befreit und schwebst dasnn in der Luft und kannst nix machen, weder rennen noch ducken noch über Hindernisse springen oder iwas reparieren - kannst auch einfach rausgehen sobald dich der Killer sieht kannste eh nich mehr wegrennen.
Manchmal fliegt man aus dem Game ohne Grunde und verliert seinen Rang und Items etc.
Die Hitboxen sind leider ein Witz, wenn der killer einen angreifen kann hat man en rotes licht hinter sich, oft mals kann er aber schon vorher angreifen bzw aus dem Fenster ziehen obwohl er grad mal in der nähe des Fensters ist.
Das Spielprinzip gut - umsetzung scheiße (Sobald der Killer dich hat campt er vor dir damit du stirbst und alle anderen entkommen)
KEIN TEAMCHAT - ganz großer Nachteil weder voicechat noch normaler chat.

Kaufen ? Jetz Gerade? Nein macht das bitte nicht sonst werden die Entwickler Faul und lassen das Game vergammeln ich meine sie haben es unbalanced und total verbuggt aus der Beta gelassen und Verkaufen jetzt die "Vollversion", ganz große abzocke bis jetz leider.

Achja es gibt keine Teamlobbys (Außer ihr spielt prvt nur mit freunden wobei ihr aber keine blutpunkte etc verdient)

So Much Fun

The game itself is fun, however the fuctionality at launch needs to be fixed for me to reccommend this game.
The matchmaking is just people lobby hopping to find friends because there is no party system, this makes lobby waits incredibly long, and if enough people leave the lobby will just stop working. There should also be some form of chat, even if its proximity and the killer can hear it, not being able to communicate at all is very frusturating.

If these things are fixed I would whole heartedly reccommend this game, however at this point it is more frusturating than fun.

need to correct the bugs and fix some issues...beside that, a freking good game !!!!

The game as itself is very entertaining, both playing as survivor and killer, both sides have their funny but also stressful moments. 

The gameplay is fun, but only for a few hours, kinda like 2 hours max and that is because the objective for both sides are always the same. For survivor, you only need to repair gens, not get caught by the killer and finally escape by opening an exit gate. Of course, there are other side things to do, i.e breaking totems or helping teammates by healing them or unhooking them, but that's just a tiny part of the main objective, survive by repairing 5 gens. 

On the other hand, the killer has a more straight forward objective and that is to find, chase, hook and sacrifice the survivors. What is interesting about this side is that every killer has its own style of doing the same objective, and that would be the killer's power. However, even though every killer is different, the objective remains the same, and that is something that I don't longer like, I would prefer something new, something innovative. From the past 4 years I've been playing this game, I have seen some pretty good ideas from the community to make a change, but they are too good to be ever considered by the devs... and now that I've mentioned them, they are the main problem for this game.

The devs are focusing too much on balancing the perks/addons/killer's power as well as some survivor's perks to make the game as fair as possible for both sides, which is not bad but they are forgetting what made Dead by Daylight unique in its own way. An action / horror game where survivors, must hide from a psychopath killer who is hunting them down to make them know despair, fear, to make them know that death, is not an escape. That was the essence that really hooked me up to play the game for a lot of hours, and that was on its first 2 years. But now, there is no longer any of that, survivors (not every single one of them) only focus on the famous "gen rush" in order to complete their objective and escape, which takes away the "horror" from the game. 

As the game is right now, the only killers that are capable of maintaining the suspense and fear in a match would only be Myers, GhostFace, The Pig and The Hag, and why them and not any other killer? Because they, in my opinion, are the only killers who can still scare the sh1t out of you when you less expect it (of course, these killers have their own exceptions when it comes to how they use their stealth but this is assuming that they use their power to surprise the survivors). And that is something that I would highly like in the game.

Dead by daylight has potential, its fun to play with friends and also alone when playing as the killer, but the path that the game is taking for the future, really doesn't convince me. If the game stays as it is, I wouldn't recommend it, but I still have my hopes for this game to change in a near future. Thank you very much for your time on reading this, I hope my opinion could give you a different perspective from the ones you've already seen.

So much money and effort being being put into every aspect of this game except...improving the actual game :/

I ended up buying and ultimately refunding this a few years ago. I dug the concept, but it was buggy, surprisingly ugly, and incredibly basic. There just wasn't much to do. Crouching behind rusty metal, sneaking around extremely chunky set pieces (which consisted of 2 main textures, muddy low res rust, and rusty low res mud), and banging on generators. And that...was literally the entire game. Rinse and repeat

But between then and now a lot of time has passed. Updates. Patches. DLC. And even I had to admit that the addition of so many horror properties to the game had me feeling a bit curious about it again. So during the steam sale I picked it up cheap, and hoped to be wowed with the new, streamlined, content laden 2020 version of Dead By Daylight!

The result...still buggy, exactly as ugly and unoptimized as before, and just as empty and basic. Only now you can play the same clunky game of hide and seek while being chased by Freddy Kruger, or Michael Myers while doing so. In all of their (bizzarely for a game in 2020) ugly low resolution textured glory. There's definitely a ton of new content to throw your cash at. But the game itself, is virtually unchanged

In the time since launch, with so much money to apparently throw at multiple horror properties, how have they not had time to add any new modes? Or at the very least update the graphics and performance to at least resemble something post 2001?

It's cool to include Silent Hill DLC, not so cool to somehow look, and control worse than the original game

It's time to talk about Dead by Daylight a 1v4 Horror game in which you either hunt down four survivors, or do whatever you can to survive and escape, questioning yourself whether it's worth risking your life to save your friends, or leave them for dead to save yourself.

It's a very fun game, but due to the fact that it lacks features that are absolutely necessary, and certain issues haven't been fixed it cannot get my recommendation.

Gameplay: I've played the beta for a very long time, mainly as the survivor mind you, but I have tried being the bad guy a couple times. Gameplay is rather simple. SURVIVORS: Fix the necessary amount of generators in order to open an exit to escape the monster. Watch out for traps, hide, and evade the monster as much as possible. You cannot fight back, and use whatever tools you can to help you on your survival. Perks and items can be used on your character if you so choose to help give you a little boost. Also listen for your heartbeat...the faster it goes the closer the monster is to finding you. 

MONSTER: Obviously Kill everyone who was dumb enough to come to your area. You can pick from three monsters all with various traits and abilities Whether you wound them or interrupt them doing something else, you pick them up and sacrifice them to whatever fucked up god you worship. Be sure to make sure they ARE sacrificed as survivors can pull them down from the meat hooks. You will have certain special abilities and will also be able to use perks to get a one up on the survivors. You can run faster than survivors, but they can climb over objects faster and knock stuff down to slow you down.

Here comes the first issue of the game...Survivors can just keep jumping over windows making it near impossible to stop them. If there are two windows in one room, they basically play ring around the rosey with the monster until he puts either a trap down, or gets so frustrated he moves away. This happened about...2/5 times I've played a match as a monster, and i've also seen it done by others.

Another Issue is that...it gets repetitive...Very fast....There's no variety in objectives which makes me sad because...I don't want to keep fixing generators. There's a lack of variety when it comes to what to do as a survivor. Fix the generator. Fix the Generator. Save/Leave friend. Fix the Generator. Run. Hide. Fix the Generator. Die/Escape. That's just about it. If you're looking a game that will keep you on your toes, force you plan and ponder what you should do next, this is not it.

Sound/Music: Sounds aren't bad, hell I'll even say they are pretty good. The immersive atmosphere is nailed as I always freak out when hearing a noise, and when i start hear the heartbeat of the monster coming, my heart starts beating as well, especially when the chase music kicks in when the monster is hot on your tail. I flinch when I spook crows and thinking I just screwed myself and gave away my position. Don't expect nothing special from this category, but it gets the job done.

Features: This is also something lacking in the department. The game has a Ranking System and a RPG system. Ranking is what you expect, a rank is given based off skill as a survivor or a monster. RPG System is...rather interesting as everytime you level up, you are given random drops essentially in which you use blood points to purchase in order to get new perks and items to help you. It's nice to see what you get when you leveled up your character.

However, the downsides for this is that there is no way to host a private match unless you have a full party. You want to play with two of your friends and fill up the game with random people? TOO BAD. They don't let you do that. And even if you just play with your friends only, YOU ARE NOT REWARDED FOR IT. For the sake of keeping people from grinding points to get more gear, they take away the reward of playing the game with just friends.

Another downside is there is NO MIC OR CHAT COMMUNICATION. A game in which requires cooperation has no way to communicate to other survivors. This would've been easy if they programmed proximity voice chat, so you can only talk to those who are close by. And the monster can have a little fun with it as well, but no. It was pulled from the game due to the fact it's an 'immersion breaker'. Honestly, I get the worries, but immersion isn't a big priority for me. It's frustrating not being able to talk to other players. You know how annoying it is for when a survivor comes to save you and the monster is hiding his presence and I want to scream for them to turn back, well you can't. They'll probably die. There is almost.

Graphics: They are nice...Nothing extraordinary but if you want a game that looks immersive, you'll get it. You don't need a top end graphics card to get it on ultra, and don't even need a good one to play it.

Overall: 6/10 It's an above average game that will give you a couple scares and the feel of being hunted down. But unless you're playing with friends, you won't be playing it for long, and good luck playing with friends as there is no lobby system. Monster can be trolled fairly easily, there is almost 0 cooperation due to the lack of voice chat so random people are going to be nothing more than stranger sto you instead of people trying to help eachother out to survive. My advice is to add proximity voice chat and also a RADIO item in which you can contact survivors globally should they have the item as well. Add a Lobby system to play with friends and Random people. Fix these exploits Survivors can use to troll the monster. Give some more variety like lock the survivors in a house and force them to find certain items to open a door to leave. But as it is now, it is not worth your money. Even at a low price like this.

Wow just wow. Truly great game. As someone who grew up on 80's horror flicks this game has it all. Ive crawled to my escape on my belly as the survivior, as the killer ive pretended not to see a survivor as i left his friend hung and dying just to double back for the good samaritan and Ive cornered 3 players at the same time in a basement which ended in a bloodbath befitting a late night gore flick.  I know I could play this game for countless hours in the state it is in. I just hope the group queue everyone is demanding doesnt ruin the awesome experience the game is right now, if you just play it the way its intended. I've only played two rounds so far, but I already am loving this game.  

In the first round I was a victim.  I didn't know what to do when I loaded in so I hid in the grass and watched everyone die. Eventually, I tried to go somewhere new and was found, stabbed and dragged to a barn. I was able to wiggle away but was immediately caught again. I kicked and beat on the killer's back as he carried me off, but he took me back in and hung me up on a meat hook. I did more wiggling and tried to get away, but a giant spider ate me instead.

The next round I chose to be the killer.  It started a bit slow and I couldn't find anyone, but then they started messing with stuff and I tracked a few of them down.  I chased one guy as he threw things down in front of me to block me, but each time I smashed through and kept following him until a girl ran close past me and I began to chase her.  I managed to hit her a few times and I knocked her down.  As I carried her on my shoulder she got herself free and ran off.  That's when I saw the guy I was going after before and decided it was definitely his time.  I chased him into a house and he kind of got away from me, but I heard a noise and went into a room where there was a dresser type thing that seemed like an obvious hiding place.  So I went to see if I could open it. I did and there he was with this scared ****less look on his face. My hand reached in and grabbed him by his neck and I threw him over my shoulder and took him out to the front yard and stuck him on a meat hook.  I smacked him with my hammer until he died.

It was glorious.

So ich gebe auch einmal meinen Senf dazu. 

Zum einen wirklich ein gelungenes Spiel. ABER nun kommen wir zu den Dingen die mich etwas traurig machen und die das Spiel etwas runter ziehen.

Da wäre zum einen das es einem nicht möglich ist mit Freunden zu Spielen außer in einer Privat Lobby. Ich verstehe das man sagt "wir wollen nicht das ihr mit euren Freunden dann alles vor free bekommt und alles hochlvlt." aber es sollte vll trotzdem irgend eine Lösung gefunden werden. 

Das nächste wäre das ich sehr oft Killer gegen mich hatte die schon Rank 1 hatten und da macht es wenig Spaß zu spielen wenn man ständig leute gegen sich hat die schon so einen hohen Rank haben und 9 Millarden Spielstunden. Das sollte man evtl. einmal anpassen damit auch Anfänger eine Chance haben und ein wenig Spielspaß haben und man auch etwas lernt und nicht nach 2 Minuten schon tot ist. Das ist besonders dann nervig wenn man alles Verliert was man dabei hatte. Das find ich wirklich mä. 

Ich persönlich würde mir vll noch ein paar mehr Charaktere wünschen und mehr möglichkeiten zum Überleben. Diese Quittimesachen sind schön aber ein bisschen mehr kann nicht schaden. 
Manchnmal finde  ich es etwas zu einfach für den Killer zumal es echt doof ist wenn man einfach nicht mehr weg kommt von Ihm und er einem am Hintern klebt. 

Aber im Ganzen kann ich das Game Empfehlen auch wenn es noch viel Luft nach oben gibt.

I love this game! Currently, you can't queue up with your friends in the ranked mode alongside randoms, but there's recently been an announcement of a "survive with friends" mode. In the same announcement, weekly patches were mentioned, so other cons such as bugs will probably be fixed.

殺人鬼はFPSで生存者はTPSなので各視点の楽しみがあります。

どちらのサイドもなかなかに面白いです、サバイバーは殺人鬼のプレイヤーを撒きながら逃げ、発電機を作動させ二つのゲートから脱出を図ります。また、最後の一人になってしまった際の救済処置としてマップのどこかにある脱出用ハッチが用意されており、ゲートをくぐらなくても逃げ切ることが可能になっている為、ハラハラドキドキの展開を楽しめます。

殺人鬼もサバイバー達を逃がさないように格殺人鬼のトラップ、スピード、ステルスといった得意分野を生かした先方駆使し、サバイバーを捕まえ生贄に捧げます。

しかし、問題点もいくつかあります。
・殺人鬼がホストなのだが、殺人鬼側が不人気なのかマッチングがなかなかしない(地域の問題の可能性もあり)
・ランク制があり、連勝しなければ最下位までどんどん下がるため少しでも上もランクの方はマッチングをしたがらない。
・殺人鬼側にバグがあり、瀕死の生存者を持ち上げるタイミングが悪いと抱える事が不可能になり自然死を待つしかなくなる。
・殺人鬼は視界が悪い上に鼓動も大きく、スキルが無い限り位置がバレやすいです。その為、生存者を捕まえて見張る事が主な戦法になってしまい仲間を見捨ててサバイバーに逃げられてしまいます。

現段階では一人捕まえて篭る戦法しか安定した戦い方が無いように思えるため、殺人鬼に少々強化が必要に思えます。例えば完全起動していない発電機の電源を初期値に戻したりとか出来ると対等な試合になると思います。

ゲーム自体はとても楽しいためお勧めします。今後のアップデートやDLCに期待です。

So i have been pumped to played this for a while...and boy was i disappointed. 

Pros:

.

Cons:

- No where to run

- Limited options for killers, they all feel like your playing as the same killer!
- Killer just camps the hooks until your dead

- Not enough variety in killers weapons
- Generators have a stupid system were you have about 2 seconds to press space

Overall, I was extremely let down, this looked like it was going to be hundreds of hours worth of my time but it turned out to be worse than evolve! I do not recommed you get this, it isn't even worth the £11.99

"Dead by Daylight" ist ein Multiplayer-Horror-Survival Game in dem sich zwei gegnerische Teams gegenüber stehen. 
Die "Killer" müssen die "Opfer" schnappen und an Haken hängen, die im Level verteilt sind.
DIe "Opfer" müssen Generatoren aktivieren um so den Levelausgang zu Öffnen. Dabei gilt es auch ein wenig taktisch zu denken. Lohnt es sich dem am Haken hängenden zu befreien und die Punkte für die Rettung zu bekommen?
Ist man der letzte wäre dies beinahe Kontraproduktiv, da die Killer meistens bis das Opfer am Haken stirbt diesen bewacht. Bin ich in der Gruppe von max. 2 Leuten könnte ich den 3ten Retten indem einer ihn ablenkt. Also Taktik und Absprache kann in diesem Game durchaus Sinnvoll sein. 

Generell ist das Spiel sehr spannend gemacht. Es gibt 3 Killerarten und jede Spielfigur kann im Level aufsteigen und so Perks und Gegenstände freischalten um sich zu besser gegen das Böse zur Wehr zu setzen. Meistens jedoch ist es am Sichersten einfach die Beine in die Hand zu nehmen und zu versuchen dem Killer irgendwie zu entkommen. 

Super: Hat der Killer dich geschnappt ist es nicht das ENDE. Man kann sich noch aus seinem Griff heraus befreien und vom Haken entkommen. 

Pro
+viele sehr gute DLCs (Killer und Überlebende und jeweils eine Map)

+gruselige Atmosphäre

+Mehrere Maps

+Mehrere Charaktere

+Teamplay



Contra
- einige wenige Bugs haben bei mir die Stimmung ein wenig vermießt.
(Beispiel: War mitten im Level und dann Endet das Level plötzlich mit der Nachricht "Entkommen")

- ein Bug sorgte dafür dass das Level nicht beendet wurde nachdem das letzte Opfer am Haken hing. Musste manuell das Level beenden. 

- Bisher nur ein Spielmodi


Mein Fazit: Letzten Endes glaube ich fest daran dass dieses Spiel enormes Potential hat, wenn die Entwickler weiterhin Content bringen und vielleicht noch einige weitere Killer und Opfer einfügen, sowie noch ein paar mehr Maps.


Livestream dazu: Ich habe den Livestream mal aufgezeichnet und möchte das Spiel euch hier nun zeigen. Macht euch selbst ein Bild davon

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=roz-ILh7ByY

I played many hours of the beta, and after a couple hours play there are a couple glaring problems I'd wait to be addressed.

The MAJOR cons :

-Can't party with friends(as a result, people contsantly leave lobbies)
-If Monster disconnects/rage quits the match ends and you can lose rank because of it
-Settings/Options are extremely limted


There are other issues as well, I'm sure other reviewers will go into much greater detail of the bugs and balancing issues. But these are the main ones I think people would want to maybe wait to be included before purchasing. 

All in all, it's a fantastically fun game with a lot of promise. Intesnse gameplay at its best. 
If the partying issue doesn't bother you, playing solo is still a lot of fun, but having 4 other friends is an absolute blast. Some of the most fun I've had goofing around in a game in a long time.

Will also review positive as soon as a friend and I can party together, they're not very clear on that in the description and I'm sure a lot of people (myself included) would be a bit miffed only to realize this after purchasing.
Actually great as hell wether you are killing your friends or running from randos this game is an actual blast

I don't write reviews much, but I felt this game could use another positive one. 

 I have been waiting for this game for a good stretch of time. When it came out, I got it for 17.00. I can say that I am very happy with the game overall. It's a 4 V 1 multiplayer game (No bots or AI controlled players) that sets four survivor players against one Killer in one of a handful large, randomly generated arenas that look like recreations of sets from some iconic horror movies. The objective of the survivor players is to light up five generators by holding the M1 button and paying attention for "skill checks" ( random quicktime button presses). Once all five generators are lit, a highlighted switch needs to be pulled, opening a large gate for escape. 

The objective of the killer is... well, kill everyone. The killer will have important points in the map highlighted, like generators. Seeing the generators will give them an idea of where the survivors could be lurking. There are three classes of killers so far. 1. the Trapper, a spooky mask wearing psycho that sets bear traps to catch his victims. 2. the Wraith, he can go invisible to stalk his prey. 3. The Hilbilly, he wields a sledgehammer and a chainsaw that he can powerup for a burst of speed and murdery goodness. The killers have to knock down the survivors and hang them on a hook that will eventually sacrifice them after a period of time. 

The survivors do not carry any weapons to fight off the killers, but they do have the ability to sense the presence of the killers ( via loud heart pounding sounds). The are slightly slower than the killer, so there are obstacles to shove over while you are running for your life. The survivors can work together to get out alive, or they can creep in the shadows and go lone wolf. If all but one survivor has been killed, an option to find a randomly generated floor hatch will open up, giving the final survivor a slightly easier way out of the arena.

Survivors and killers earn levels through matches by working together, completing objectives, healing and rescuing each other, escaping the killer, and a few other things. The points can be used to purchase items and skills via "Blood Web" to use in the matches. be careful what items you take into a match though, if you die, the item is lost. 

For the price, I'd say this game is well worth it. One last thing, there is no voice or text chat in the game. So unless you are using a chat program with friends, you are going to feel pretty alone out there.   Good luck!

A very fun, suspenseful multiplayer game. Whether you're hiding from the killer or stalking the survivors, your heartrate is going to rise. A few issues with the lobbies aside, once the game gets going it's insanely fun.

The problem with the lobbies is an issue, however. It seems like people want to play with their friends more often than not. Some sort of partying system would benefit this game greatly.

Other than that, I definitely recommend this game.

Tru killer's story:
> Catch one survivor
> Hang him on the hook
> When you are suppost to go away about second later, another survivor comes, trying to rescue him
> Hit another survivor with chainsaw before he manage to rescue friend
> Grab him and go to other hook
> Wild third survivor appears!
> Third survivor used "Take your friend off the hook!"
> Drop survivor u held, hit 3rd survivor
> Hang 3rd survivor on the hook meant for 1st survivor
> 1st survivor tries to take 3rd off the hook, ignoring the fact i'm standing right beside, watching
> Grab 1st survivor
> Go to other hook, and hang him there
> Go back and find 2nd survivor inches away from place you've left him(yes, you can move while knocked down)
> Hang him on another hook
> 4th survivor disconnected
10/10 human worse than AI

Tru human story:
> Save a girl from a hook
> Killer chainsaws you then hang you on the hook
> The girl you've saved runs away toward exit
Never felt so betrayed before. Liek if u cri evritiem.

Update nach 92 Stunden Spielzeit:
DANKE liebe Entwickler, das ihr Freunden die Chance gegeben habt als Team in eine Lobby einzusteigen! Das ist für mich ein echter Pluspunkt.

ABER:
BITTE liebe Entwickler, könnt ihr diese Möglichkeit jetzt auch noch so anpassen, das man nicht 30 Minuten in der Lobby alle 15 Sekunden auf "Fertig" drücken muss um dann in der Killerlobby festzustellen, dass der Killer die Lobby verlässt weil er Angst hat gegen die "guten" Überlebenden zu verlieren und man sich dann wieder von neuem für 30 Minuten auf die Suche nach einer Lobby machen kann um erneut das selbe festzustellen und gefühlt nach 2 Stunden das erste Spiel zu finden was dann innerhalb von 3 Minuten und 13 Sekunden endet, weil der Killer den ersten findet und aufhängt, alle anderen Überlebenden hin laufen um ihn zu retten, der Killer aber (wie gefühlt 98% der Killer) campt, den ersten erschlägt und liegen lässt, den zweiten erschlägt und liegen lässt, den dritten erschlägt und liegen lässt, wartet bis alle 3 verblutet sind, keiner was von dem Spiel hatte aber sich jeder nochmal 2 Stunden auf die lustige Lobbysuche macht, weil das Spiel einfach verdammt nochmal Spaß macht wenn man mal nicht 2 Stunden wartet und ein 3 Minuten und 13 Sekunden spiel erwischt. Falls es jemand bis hier hin schafft: das war der längste Satz meines Lebens.
